featured.text: Our bodies have evolved to exist within Earth’s gravity (1 g), not in the weightlessness of space (0 g) or the microgravity of Mars (0.3 g).
Besides working, regular exercise is essential to keep the astronauts healthy in microgravity.
Also, astronauts conduct experiments on the shuttle to learn how space conditions, such as microgravity, affect humans, animals, plants, and insects.

definition.zh_def: 微重力，指在接近零重力的環境中，物體所受的重力極小，通常在太空中出現。
definition.en_def: Microgravity refers to a condition in which objects appear to be weightless and experience very small gravitational forces, typically found in space.
definition.example: Astronauts conduct experiments in microgravity to study the effects of low gravity on various materials.
